trans-unit.source: Represents an installed speech synthesis engine.
A voice is an installed speech synthesis engine, which is also referred to as a text-to-speech engine or a TTS engine.
The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.SpeechSynthesizer> object uses a voice to generate speech from text.
The properties of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.VoiceInfo> object identify a voice and describe its characteristics.
The most defining characteristic of a voice is its <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.VoiceInfo.Culture%2A>, which defines the single language that a voice can speak.

The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.SpeechSynthesizer.Voice%2A> property returns a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.VoiceInfo> object that contains information about the current voice in use by the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.SpeechSynthesizer>.

You can also use a <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.VoiceInfo> object to get information about any of the voices that are installed on the system, as returned by the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.SpeechSynthesizer.GetInstalledVoices> method.
See <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.InstalledVoice> for more information.
Gets additional information about the voice.
Returns a collection of name/value pairs that describe and identify the voice.
Gets the age of the voice.
The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.VoiceInfo.Age%2A> property gets a member of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.VoiceAge> enumeration that indicates the age of the voice.
Returns the age of the voice.
Gets the culture of the voice.
The <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> class specifies a unique name for each culture.
The name is a combination of an ISO 639 two-letter lowercase culture code associated with a language and an ISO 3166 two-letter uppercase subculture code associated with a country or region.
Examples of culture names include "es-US" for Spanish as spoken in the US, or "fr-CA" for French as spoken in Canada.
You can specify a neutral culture by using only the two-digit lowercase language code.
For example, "fr" specifies the neutral culture for French, and "de" specifies the neutral culture for German.

Returns a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that provides information about a specific culture, such as the names of the culture, the writing system, the calendar used, and how to format dates and sort strings.
Gets the description of the voice.
Returns the description of the voice.
Compares the fields of the voice with the specified <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.VoiceInfo"></xref> object to determine whether they contain the same values.
The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.VoiceInfo.Equals%2A> method takes a <xref:System.Object> type as its parameter.
If that object is not of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.VoiceInfo> type, the method returns `False`.
The specified <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.VoiceInfo"></xref> object.
Returns `True` if the fields of the two <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.VoiceInfo"></xref> objects are equal; otherwise returns `False`.
Gets the gender of the voice.
The <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.VoiceInfo.Gender%2A> property gets a member of the <xref:System.Speech.Synthesis.VoiceGender> enumeration that indicates the gender of the voice.
Returns the gender of the voice.
Provides a hash code for a VoiceInfo object.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Speech.Synthesis.VoiceInfo"></xref> object.
Gets the ID of the voice.
Returns the identifier for the voice.
Gets the name of the voice.
Returns the name of the voice.
Gets the collection of audio formats that the voice supports.
Returns a collection of the audio formats that the voice supports.
